column1: The majority of the people are Roman Catholics. column1: Santa Rosa is considered as the premier city and hub of South Luzon. It is also known as the Lion City of South Luzon. According to the 2013 COA AFR report
column2: the city has an annual income of 2.3 billion pesos
column3: surpassing the income of Calamba and Batangas City. Santa Rosa is now the richest city in Luzon outside of Metro Manila in terms of annual income.

column1: Santa Rosa's source of electricity is part of the Manila Electric Company or Meralco. Water supply for the city is supplied by the Laguna Water Inc. column1: Santa Rosa City is governed primarily by the city mayor
column2: the vice mayor and the city councilors. The mayor acts as the chief executive of the city while the city councilors acts as its legislative body. The vice mayor
column3: besides taking on mayoral responsibilities in case of a temporary vacancy
column4: acts as the presiding officer of the city legislature. The legislative body is composed of 10 regular members and representatives from the barangay and the youth council.
